metadata.title: Build Patient List Page UI with Search/Filters/Empty States
metadata.prd_reference: Feature 3 Patient List + user empty-state guidance

context.background: This task implements Build Patient List Page UI with Search/Filters/Empty States for Healio and is scoped as one atomic work item aligned to the PRD. It should be completed within 45 mins and leave clear evidence for follow-on tasks.

design_constraints.constraint: Use Stripe-like frictionless workflows: create/edit actions should open centered modals or slide-out drawers instead of disruptive full-page forms.
Use a Viedoc-style bento layout: soft floating white cards on an off-white background for dashboards and dense data views.
Apply the Paper Replacement palette: app background near #F9FAFB, white cards, calm trustworthy accents (teal/sage/cerulean), and reserve red for critical alerts only.
Preserve high-legibility typography: clean sans-serif (Inter/SF Pro/Halyard), bold patient names, slate-gray secondary metadata.
Honor the one-click rule where applicable: keep the global + action for Add Appointment, Add Patient, and Create Invoice visible and easy to reach.
Add educational empty states with clear CTAs for first-time or empty datasets.

instruction.step: Implement the scoped changes for Build Patient List Page UI with Search/Filters/Empty States in the planned files (healio/app/(dashboard)/patients/page.tsx, healio/components/patients/patient-list.tsx, healio/components/patients/patient-search-filters.tsx, healio/hooks/usePatients.ts) while preserving the PRD-aligned project structure.
Apply validation, error handling, and consistent response/UI behavior so the task output integrates cleanly with existing helpers and patterns.
Wire integrations and dependencies for this task (endpoints: GET /api/v1/patients) and keep tenant scoping/RBAC/security expectations intact where applicable.
Prefer in-context modal/drawer workflows, scannable bento cards, and educational empty states so the UI matches the requested Healio experience.
Verify keyboard/focus behavior, touch target sizing, and mobile responsiveness before marking the task ready.

validation_checklist.check: Exercise the related endpoint(s): GET /api/v1/patients and verify response shape/status codes.
Run lint/typecheck or the smallest relevant test suite for the files changed by this task.
Manually verify desktop and mobile layouts plus focus/keyboard behavior for the primary interaction path.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP to verify the implemented UI in-browser (desktop + mobile), check interactions, inspect console errors, and capture a validation snapshot before marking done.
Capture a screenshot or short note confirming empty/loading/error states are present where applicable.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The deliverable for Build Patient List Page UI with Search/Filters/Empty States is implemented in the referenced files and compiles without breaking adjacent modules.
Task output matches the PRD scope (Feature 3 Patient List + user empty-state guidance) and remains bounded to an atomic <=45-minute implementation chunk.
Related endpoint behavior returns the standard success/error envelope and respects auth/public route expectations for the route class.
UI states (loading, empty, error, success) are present and visually consistent with Healio bento cards, off-white background, and trust-oriented styling.
Interactions are keyboard accessible and usable on mobile without disruptive navigation when a modal/drawer workflow is appropriate.

execution_tracking.verification_command: npm run typecheck; node --import tsx --test tests/unit/patients-route.test.ts; Chrome DevTools MCP on http://localhost:4010/patients
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Built the initial patient list page (`/patients`) with bento summary cards, search + page-size filters, pagination, and educational empty/no-results states. Added a React Query `usePatientsList` hook with a localhost auth-header shim and Chrome DevTools MCP verification on desktop/mobile. DevTools a11y snapshots showed duplicate stale entries after page-size changes, but direct DOM inspection (`document.querySelectorAll('main article').length`) confirmed the rendered list count was correct (12), so this was treated as a snapshot artifact rather than a UI defect.

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, test commands, screenshots (UI tasks), and commit/PR references here.
Include Chrome DevTools MCP evidence (snapshot/screenshot reference and notes on responsive + interaction checks) here before marking frontend tasks complete.

Changed files: healio/app/(dashboard)/patients/page.tsx, healio/components/patients/patient-list.tsx, healio/components/patients/patient-search-filters.tsx, healio/hooks/usePatients.ts, healio/lib/query-keys.ts, healio/tsconfig.tsbuildinfo.
API regression check: `node --import tsx --test tests/unit/patients-route.test.ts` passed (GET /api/v1/patients list query and route behavior still valid).

Chrome DevTools MCP verification (http://localhost:4010/patients): desktop and mobile snapshots captured; verified initial empty state, populated list state after local API seeding, no-results state via search (`zzz-no-match`), pagination (page 1→2), page-size filter (10→20), and responsive mobile layout with bottom nav visible.

Chrome DevTools MCP network evidence: GET `/api/v1/patients?page=1&pageSize=10` (200), GET search queries (200), GET pagination/page-size transitions (200); local seeding via DevTools `fetch` issued 12x POST `/api/v1/patients` (201).
Chrome DevTools MCP console check: no app errors; only standard React DevTools development info message.
Implementation commit: 63b9a9c (feat(healio-patients): patient list page ui).
